definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: The first U. S. Prisident George Washington is on the dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 首任美國總統喬治華盛頓的像在一元美鈔上。

sentences.english: You might think that it would be easy to make a phony dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 你也許會認爲製造假美鈔很容易。

sentences.english: The soldiers will be paid in coin or green backs as the case may be.
sentences.chinese: 士兵的薪餉是發硬幣還是美鈔，視情形而定。

sentences.english: The United States Secret Service has made definitive connections between the supernote and the government of North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 美國特勤局認爲超級美鈔和北韓政府有確切的聯繫。

sentences.english: Sorry, these two one hundred dollar bills are counterfeit.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，這兩張百元美鈔是僞造的。

sentences.english: Americans cowboys should stop printing their dollars firstly, thereby preventing the inflations all around the world.
sentences.chinese: 美國牛仔首先應該停止印美鈔，別讓全世界陷入通脹。

sentences.english: Okay. Can you change a thousand-dollar bill?
sentences.chinese: 好的。千元美鈔你能找零嗎？

sentences.english: Washington has imposed financial sanctions on North Korean-linked companies suspected of money-laundering counterfeit U. S. dollars for Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 華盛頓對涉嫌北韓僞造美鈔的有關公司實施制裁。

definition: a device used to check money and detect counterfeit bills
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
bill of warrant (certificate, allowing one to collect money or valuables)
